TopicTitle: Someone on youtube just admitted to torrenting KSP.

Articles.Content:
I\'m not sure if this is the place to report it, but this is very disappointing. The devs worked very hard and deserve at least something as little as 15 dollars. 

This is the guy\'s youtube account. I don\'t know how much further you\'ll be able to take it.

[http://www.youtube.com/user/Chandler312](https://www.youtube.com/user/Chandler312)

He admitted to it on Scott Manley\'s video.

<iframe width="459" height="344" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/t0x_53X3l-Q?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

>![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif) Dude! Looks like he did and felt good about it >![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif)

He needs his head seperated fro his body (not that I\'m a serial killer)

Someone needs to shut it down.

Before you go apeshit, why don\'t you ask him why he torrented it, and if it\'s something like 'I don\'t have the money :\'(', then you know why.

And if that is the case, then, he will probably buy it as soon as he has the money.

If you are smart about it you will realize that any PR is good PR. For example, Minecraft doesn\'t mind piracy, Notch the creator of it welcomes it. He knows that a good product sells itself. Word of mouth and so on. And look how minecraft is thriving. A person that is going to play the game for a longer time will probably buy it. What the people on youtube are doing is the major selling point if you ask me, all the lets plays. Thats how i learned about KSP before i bought it.

Also i see no reason why this needs to be reported nor why anyone thinks they should play internet police about it. Nothing can be done about it. All you can do is better your product and show those that pirate it that its worth buying.
Didn\'t we already have this discussion?
No. I just found out about this guy today.

> 
> Before you go apeshit, why don\'t you ask him why he torrented it, and if it\'s something like 'I don\'t have the money :\'(', then you know why.
> 
> And if that is the case, then, he will probably buy it as soon as he has the money.

He did it just because he could. He was proud to brag about it and encouraged people to torrent it.

> 
> Didn\'t we already have this discussion?

Yes and a long one at that, please, no, DO NOT encourage piracy in any form. there are no excuses.

> 
> Yes and a long one at that, please, no, DO NOT encourage piracy in any form. there are no excuses.

This discussion is hinting that there indeed is KSP available via torrents - delete the thread, quick, before someone finds out!

[mod]Annnnd we're done here. Squad will handle it from here.[/mod]

Cheers!

Capt\'n Skunky

KSP Community Manager
